ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 12 Space Environment Monitor Data, X-ray, Magnetic Field, Electrons and Corrected Proton Channels, at 5 min Time Resolution
ResourceHeader.Description: This GOES 12 SEM data set contains various parameters at 5 min time resolution. Within the data files is the Xray flux for two wavelength ranges, the magnetic field vectors, the >2 MeV uncorrected electron fluxes, and the corrected proton fluxes for several energy ranges.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NOAA Environmental Research Laboratories, Terry G. Onsager, Howard J. Singer

InformationURL.Name: GOES 12 Space Environment Monitor
InformationURL.Description: Introduction to the GOES 12 space environment monitor.

InformationURL.Name: GOES 12 Space Environment Monitor
InformationURL.Description: Additional GOES Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer information.

InformationURL.Name: GOES 12 Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer Example ASCII file
InformationURL.Description: Additional GOES Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer header information.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 12 SEM data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 12 SEM data in ASCII format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, A0558606.FIT indicates the type of particle data (A) for spacecraft 5 (05) at 5 min time resolution (5) from June 1986 (8606).

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NOAA Environmental Research Laboratories, Terry G. Onsager, Howard J. Singer

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is YYMMDD HHMM DOY (2-digit year, 2-digit month, 2-digit day, 2-digit hour, 2-digit minute, and 3-digit day of year.

Parameter.Name: Date and Time
Parameter.Description: Time is given in 3 columns. Time format in data files is YYMMDD HHMM DOY (2-digit year, 2-digit month, 2-digit day, 2-digit hour, 2-digit minute, and 3-digit day of year.

Parameter.Name: Solar X-ray Monitor
Parameter.Description: Solar X-ray monitor flux in Two different wavelength ranges in units of W/m^2

Structure.Description: Solar X-ray monitor fluxes from two wavelength ranges: 1 to 8 Å and 0.5 to 4 Å

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Sensor Magnetic Field Vectors at 5 min Time Resolution Data in Spacecraft Coordinates
Parameter.Description: Magnetic field vector for GOES 12 in spacecraft coordinates in units of 0.1 nT. The values must be divided by a factor of 10 to nT. HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the orbital plane of the spacecraft. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward for GOES 12.

Structure.Description: HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the orbital plane of the spacecraft. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward for GOES 12.

Parameter.Name: 2 MeV electrons
Parameter.Description: Uncorrected ≥2 MeV electrons number fluxes in units of counts/(cm^2 s sr). These values are especially unreliable during ion storms.

Parameter.Name: Corrected Protons
Parameter.Description: Corrected Proton number fluxes in units of counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV) for 7 different energy channels.

Structure.Description: Each Name provides the energy range for each channel.

Element.Name: 0.8 to 4.0 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
4 to 9 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
9 to 15 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
15 to 40 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
40 to 80 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
80 to 165 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
165 to 500 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), Corrected
